work.name: Endless Frontier Labs
work.summary: Developed a ranking tool for over 1,600 VC investment candidates using Python and Spark, leveraging historical success factors to optimize decision-making. Implemented a microservice with Python and AWS Lambda, utilizing the stable marriage algorithm to match potential hires with 200+ startups, significantly reducing churn. Additionally, improved website performance by migrating to a multi-tier architecture, increasing the Lighthouse score from 77 to 92.

work.name: Hype AI
work.summary: Led the enhancement of an AI image generation feature, boosting customer satisfaction by 35% through model fine-tuning to minimize content artifacts. Expanded user creative control with TypeScript and NestJS, introducing customizable options for lighting, camera angle, and size, significantly improving user experience. Additionally, overhauled the document management system with a scalable MongoDB schema and designed GraphQL APIs for efficient hierarchical folder organization, sharing, CRUD operations, global search, and user-specific access controls.

work.name: Deloitte
work.summary: Led the development of cloud alert management systems for a Fortune 100 company, saving over 500 analyst hours annually, and built advanced cyber threat detection tools using TypeScript, Python, and PyTorch. These efforts enabled the Sec-Ops team to surpass cybersecurity QoS metrics, reducing incident response time by 40% and preventing potential breaches. Additionally, I mentored interns, facilitated knowledge transfer sessions, and consistently maintained a high utilization rate of over 90%.

work.name: HW Saver
work.summary: As part of an 8-engineer team at an ed-tech startup, I developed a tool for solving complex math equations, integrating a React frontend for tokenization, a Django backend for processing solutions, and PostgreSQL for database management. I also spearheaded the automation of software delivery using Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, and Selenium, resulting in a 6x reduction in deployment times.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

education.studyType: Master of Science in Computer Engineering
Bachelor of Technology in Computer Science

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
